programmes.show_description: Connor Phillips is live through the night from Salford as he asks 'what have you misheard?'. Plus, Midnight Mastermind, Wish You Were There and Shiftfaced.

programmes.show_name: Dance Sounds of the 90s with Vernon Kay
programmes.show_description: Get into the groove, spin around and fulfil your fantasies with you nothing but the biggest dance pop hits from the 90s!
It's Early Breakfast with Owain Wyn Evans, featuring Airdrum Anthems and Step Back in Time. What have you purchased that lives in the cupboard and rarely sees the light of day?
Scott's got another round of Elder Versus Millennial for you to educate the younger people in your life! Plus the Birthday Game or take on the Easiest Quiz on the Radio.
Two listeners take on Vernon's mid-morning music quiz Ten To The Top, and Vern goes digging for more classic BBC audio gold in Vernon's Vault.
Appleton - aka Natalie and Nicole Appleton - perform alongside the BBC Concert Orchestra from BBC Maida Vale studios for Radio 2's Piano Room Month.
Jeremy discusses the arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, EHCPs for SEND school pupils, building muscle strength to prevent falls and noisy fridges.
Trevor is bringing you some of the best music from across the decades to get you through the afternoon.
OJ gets you through teatime! He's got the One Breath Review, Mid-Afternoon Mastermind and Publican Service Broadcasting.
OJ Borg plays the biggest and best tunes to get you up dancing!
Shaun Keaveny sits in with 30 minutes of feel-good music from 7-7.30pm to soundtrack listeners' weekday evening.
Shaun chats to Tim Burgess of The Charlatans about their recent album 'We are Love' & their upcoming UK tour. He also has a first play of a new track from Pulp.
Appleton perform latest single, Falling Into You, the All Saints hit Black Coffee and the Glen Campbell classic, Wichita Lineman, performed live with the BBC Concert Orchestra.

programmes.show_name: The Country Show with Bob Harris
programmes.show_description: Just got an hour? All the country you need to know, right here! Superstar Megan Moroney is Bob's guest, introducing songs from her new album!

programmes.show_name: The Good Groove with Angellica Bell
programmes.show_description: Thursday's the new Friday so Angellica's enlisted the help of Bluey from Incognito to do a special Good Groove mix. Filled with stone-cold and future classics - get ready to dance!
Connor Phillips is live through the night live from the Salford Riviera with Midnight Mastermind, Wish You Were There, Midnight Caller and a huge Ravio 2 to end the week.

programmes.show_name: Alternative Sounds of the 90s with Dermot O'Leary
programmes.show_description: Jude Law picks his favourite 90s band. Plus a mix of known and unknown tunes from JJ72, Asian Dub Foundation, Milltown Brothers and Death In Vegas.
Welcome! It's Early Breakfast with Owain Wyn Evans, featuring Airdrum Anthems and Step Back in Time. The 3 Ws today. Who are you, Where are you, What are you looking forward to?
Scott's got an iconic trio of guests with him in the studio for Big Guest Friday. It's comedian Jack Whitehall, Bake Off legend Prue Leith and singing sensation Beverley Knight!
Vernon is here to warm you up for the weekend ahead, with the final edition of Ten To The Top of the week.
Vernon has highlights from Week 3 of Radio 2's Piano Room Month 2026 - featuring Labi Siffre, Ella Eyre, Squeeze and Appleton accompanied by the BBC Concert Orchestra.
Jeremy and guests discuss the news headlines and talk to the people making them.
Trevor is bringing you some of the best music from across the decades to get you through the afternoon.
It's All Request Friday, and OJ Borg wants to hear from you on 88291 or sara.cox@bbc.co.uk.
A handpicked playlist of her favourite disco, dance, pop and R'n'B bangers.
Michelle's Mood is...ANIMATE ME! Your weekly 30 minutes of non-stop bops right here.
The Disco Zone is GO! Here comes two hours of tunes to move to. Sophie plays music from Spice Girls, Rudimental, One Direction, Beyonce and Vanilla Ice!

programmes.show_name: The Rock Show with Shaun Keaveny
programmes.show_description: Shaun curates an hour of the best rock ever heard on Radio 2.
